nodes.bodyText: this will again be a new content type? that change is will be followed by this one?

No. As I mentioned in the summary, the choice of using zigzag is the sensible default in most cases.
For the tensor use cases, they often need more control over encoding (for example encoding indices using run length encoding etc.) so they extend ProtobufDataCodec and create application specific custom content types.
Given this, I am inclined to not create a new content type in rest.li for this now, and revisit in the future, if this becomes more of a generic requirement.
This mirrors what we are doing for PSON today, where some of the options like encode string length and collection length are disabled by default, and are enabled in extensions of PSON in some applications with injected application specific custom content types.
do we need this? writing size can be skipped here right? same with int64
We are not writing size here. We are flushing the buffer if needed and making sure that at least 4 bytes in the case of int and 8 bytes in the case of double are available to write in the buffer.
